item.title: Wall Street is on tenterhooks over the Fed’s ‘rare, genuinely suspenseful’ December meeting—the committee is unsure of the data, and each other
item.description: A divided Fed meets amid mixed jobs and inflation signals, leaving Powell with a suspenseful December.

item.title: Amazon CTO Werner Vogels just released his 2026 tech predictions. He’s most optimistic about ‘personalized learning’ and ‘renaissance developers’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Amazon CTO’s 2026 tech predictions include the dawn of the ‘renaissance developer’: ‘You need polymaths like Da Vinci’
item.description: Vogels says his annual list of tech predictions is more optimistic than it may seem.

item.title: Deloitte just got caught again citing fabricated and AI-generated research—this time in a million-dollar report for the Canadian government
item.description: In a healthcare report aimed to address a nurse and doctor shortage, Deloitte cited several fake studies with real researchers’ names attached.

item.title: Global e-commerce startup funding hits 2020s low, while 2025 U.S. holiday spending could break records
item.description: In 2021, global e-commerce-related startup funding peaked, but in 2025 those numbers have come crashing down to around $7 billion for the year, per Cr...
